Description: Glazed composition head of a griffin, solid, with ruff indicated by narrow band with incisions round face and down to point on neck under chin. Left horn partly survives, other horn and ears rubbed off. Central ridge down back of neck. Glaze all gone, core hard, medium texture, putty colour.
Dimensions: Diameter: 1.90 centimetres (width across base of neck side to side)
Width: 3.30 centimetres (across face outside of ruff)
Curator's comments: This piece belongs with a group of finds which date to the Achaemenid period and reproduce the griffin which occurs in Persian architecture and art.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. I, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ON.06)
